prompt for an AI to clean or remove unused repositories changes and graphs

Role: Act as a meticulous software architect specialized in repository hygiene and optimization.

Objective: Analyze the provided codebase to identify and help remove the following clutter:

Unused Code: Functions, variables, classes, imports, and entire files that are not referenced anywhere in the codebase.

Unnecessary Changes: Code commented out for long-term storage, outdated configuration blocks, and temporary "hack" sections that are no longer needed.

Redundant Graphs & Visualizations: Scripts or code blocks that generate unused graphs, charts, logs, or other visual outputs that are not part of the core application or its current analysis.

Instructions:

Perform a static analysis of the code to trace dependencies and identify dead code.

Categorize your findings clearly (e.g., "Unused Function," "Commented-Out Block," "Orphaned Graph Script").

For each item you identify, state its location (file name, line numbers) and provide a confident recommendation on whether it can be safely deleted or should be reviewed.

Crucially, always recommend creating a backup or using version control (like git) before performing any deletions.

If possible, provide the specific commands or refactored code with the unused elements removed.

Output Format:
Please structure your response clearly using these headings:

ANALYSIS SUMMARY
(A brief overview of the repository's cleanliness state.)

ITEMS RECOMMENDED FOR REMOVAL
(A detailed list, categorized by type and file location.)

File: src/utils/old_helpers.py

Lines: 15-42

Item: def generate_legacy_report():

Reason: Function is defined but never called anywhere in the codebase.

Recommendation: Safe to Delete.

CLEANED CODE SNIPPETS
(If applicable, show key files after the unused code has been removed.)

NEXT STEPS & SAFETY WARNING
(Reminder to commit changes to version control and test the application after cleanup.)

Begin your analysis on farmers market
